question: How is mTORC1 involved in the regulation of heat stress?
ideal_answer: mTORC1 attenuates stress response by inhibiting cap-independent Hsp70 translation.

snippets.text: PI3K-mTORC1 attenuates stress response by inhibiting cap-independent Hsp70 translation
stress-induced preferential translation of Hsp70 mRNA is negatively regulated by PI3K-mTORC1 signaling
Conversely, Hsp70 synthesis is enhanced under the reduced PI3K-mTORC1 signaling
Our findings imply a plausible mechanism for how persistent PI3K-mTORC1 signaling favors the development of age-related pathologies by attenuating stress resistance

One prominent example is the selective translation of heat shock proteins (Hsps) under stress conditions. Although the transcriptional regulation of Hsp genes has been well established, neither the specific translation-promoting features nor the regulatory mechanism of the translation machinery have been clearly defined. Here we show that the stress-induced preferential translation of Hsp70 mRNA is negatively regulated by PI3K-mTORC1 signaling.
PI3K-mTORC1 attenuates stress response by inhibiting cap-independent Hsp70 translation.
